spoken-english-week12_key2:
Hello!! 
This is your Class 12 for Spoken English course module.
spoken-english-week12_key6: What is the one skill that you would like to learn ?
spoken-english-week12_key7: Which is your favorite subject at school and why ?
spoken-english-week12_key9:
**Similes & Metaphors**
Similes - A comparison of 2 things using words like “like” or “as”. For example, “As sly as a fox”.
spoken-english-week12_key10: Metaphor - A direct comparison of 2 words without using “like” or “as”.
spoken-english-week12_key11: An example of a metaphor is “Life is a journey”. This means that life is long and has many ups and downs like any journey.
spoken-english-week12_key14: Blue color represents sadness - I am feeling sad
spoken-english-week12_key15: Example: I am feeling blue because my team lost the match
spoken-english-week12_key18: Relaxed, or chilled out - not stressed
spoken-english-week12_key19: Example: On the first day of class, I felt cool as a cucumber
spoken-english-week12_key20: C) “The test was a piece of cake”
spoken-english-week12_key22: Meaning: The test was easy - Easy, since cake is pretty easy and yummy to eat
spoken-english-week12_key23: Example: The test was a piece of cake, I am going to get 100%
spoken-english-week12_key26: Meaning: Very busy, like a bee constantly buzzes
spoken-english-week12_key27:
Example: My mom is as busy as a bee

E) “He is a shining star”
spoken-english-week12_key30: Example: He helped me so much, he is a shining star
spoken-english-week12_key32: Meaning: To sleep very soundly, it may be hard to wake you up up - like if you were a log
spoken-english-week12_key33: Example: I was so tired, I slept like a log”
spoken-english-week12_key36: Meaning: You are bright and bring happiness to my life, like sunshine
spoken-english-week12_key37: Context: Can use this while thanking a loved one.
spoken-english-week12_key40: Meaning: Person who is cheerful - like the bubbles in soda
spoken-english-week12_key41:
Example: Her bubbly personality makes everyone happy

I) “As quiet as a mouse”
spoken-english-week12_key43: Meaning: Very quiet, like a mouse
spoken-english-week12_key44: Example: I didn’t hear him walking, he was as quiet as a mouse
spoken-english-week12_key46: Attendance (noun): the action or state of going regularly to or being present at a place or event.
spoken-english-week12_key47:
Attend (verb)
Eg.: Attendance at the meeting is mandatory.
I want to attend my friend's birthday party.
Alternate usage: the number of times a person attends
a student who has perfect attendance [=a student who has been
present at every class]
spoken-english-week12_key50: What is the one skill you would like to learn ?
spoken-english-week12_key51: Which is your favorite subject at school and why ?
spoken-english-week12_key54: Similes - A comparison of 2 things using words like “like” or “as”. For example, “As sly as a fox”.
spoken-english-week12_key55: Metaphor - A direct comparison of 2 words without using “like” or “as”.
spoken-english-week12_key56: An example of a metaphor is “Life is a journey”. This means that life is long and has many ups and downs like any journey.
spoken-english-week12_key57: Idiom - An expression that means something different than the words used.
spoken-english-week12_key60: Blue color represents sadness - I am feeling sad
spoken-english-week12_key61: Example: I am feeling blue because my team lost the match
spoken-english-week12_key64: Relaxed, or chilled out - not stressed
spoken-english-week12_key65: Example: On the first day of class, I felt cool as a cucumber
spoken-english-week12_key66: C) “The test was a piece of cake”
spoken-english-week12_key68: Meaning: The test was easy - Easy, since cake is pretty easy and yummy to eat
spoken-english-week12_key69: Example: The test was a piece of cake, I am going to get 100%
spoken-english-week12_key73: Example: A: “Can we climb Mount Everest?” B: “When pigs fly”
spoken-english-week12_key77: Example: He helped me so much, he is a shining star
spoken-english-week12_key80: Meaning: To try to do something
spoken-english-week12_key81: Example: Give it a shot, you might succeed.
spoken-english-week12_key84: Meaning: You are bright and bring happiness to my life, like sunshine
spoken-english-week12_key85: Context: Can use this while thanking a loved one.
spoken-english-week12_key88: Meaning: Feeling nervous - refers to the feeling in your stomach
spoken-english-week12_key89: Example: I had butterflies in my stomach before my speech
spoken-english-week12_key92: Meaning: Very quiet, like a mouse
spoken-english-week12_key93: Example: I didn’t hear him walking, he was as quiet as a mouse
spoken-english-week12_key96: Meaning: Person who is cheerful - like the bubbles in soda
spoken-english-week12_key97: Example: Her bubbly personality makes everyone happy
spoken-english-week12_key100: Meaning: To sleep very soundly, it may be hard to wake you up up - like if you were a log
spoken-english-week12_key101: Example: I was so tired, I slept like a log”
spoken-english-week12_key103: Attendance (noun): the action or state of going regularly to or being present at a place or event.
spoken-english-week12_key105:
Eg.: Attendance at the meeting is mandatory.
I want to attend my friend's birthday party.
Alternate usage: the number of times a person attends a student who has perfect attendance [=a student who has been present at every class]
spoken-english-week12_key106:
Attention: notice taken of someone or something; the regarding of someone or something as interesting or
important.
spoken-english-week12_key107: Eg.: You should pay attention to what she says.
